main event: A white, parallel-shaped object, the size of a quarter, was observed moving at a slow and steady pace in Marlboro, New York on August 2, 1958.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes., The object was reported to move underneath low cloud cover., The sighting was classified as a ground-visual observation., The object was thought to possibly be a searchlight based on its movement and the conditions., Only one object was reported during the sighting.
